name: DK050: Todos Caerán - Town of Cats 12" LP - White /100, Blue/Grey Mix /200
description: SHIPPING NOW 12/12/13 DK050 Todos Caerán - Town of Cats 12" LP After many years of playing various styles of music together, in 2009 Todos Caeran formed and began writing post rock influenced screamo. Now, nearly 4 years later and after a host of releases including an EP, full length and 6 splits, as well as a line up change which brought in two new integral members, they return with their sophomore LP, Town of Cats. Following in the footsteps of their first album, After Dark, Town of Cats weaves between pounding, driving crescendos and soft eerie lulls for six tracks lyrically inspired by the works of Haruki Murakami. Pulling influences from multiple bands and genres and mixing them together amid the cold Canadian winter has pushed Todos Caeran’s sound from mere Funeral Diner worship to something more explosive and dynamic which they can call their own. All artwork by Rodrigo Almanegra. name: DK038: Old Gray - An Autobiography 12" LP - 2nd Press - Gold /150, Silver /150
description: DK038 Old Gray – An Autobiography 12" LP 2nd Press with Two new vinyl colourways and new centre labels. “An Autobiography is our debut full length record, and as such, means a lot to us. We look at each of our releases as a representation of where we are in our lives at the time of us writing; the same couldn't be truer about this album. These eight songs are incredibly personal, as Cameron, Charlie, and I opened up as much as we could, with lyrical material ranging from a fear of death, a curiosity of death, loss, loneliness, self loathing, and more. This is the first release of ours that wasn't recorded by our friend Zak Ickes; rather, we travelled down to Dead Air Studios and recorded with the venerable Will Killingsworth, known for his work in bands such as Ampere and Orchid. Working with him was a phenomenal opportunity and was a very rewarding experience, further emphasizing the importance of this album to us. Even the album art has a very specific and calculated meaning; the three flowers represent the three of us, equal parts terrifyingly alone and comfortably together, and the photo was taken by Cameron's long-time friend, Michi Tassey. Musically, we explored our sound a lot more on this record than we have in the past, most notably with the addition of violin, played by our friend Nick Kwas. We also had Becca Cadalzo, vocalist of esteemed hardcore band Cerce, supply some of her trademark fearsome vocals. All in all, we just hope that this album is as important to our listeners as it is to us.” Stream the release in full at: Dog Knights Bandcamp PRESSING INFO Transparent Blue /100 Sold Out White with Gold and Silver Splatter /200 Sold Out Gold /150 Silver /150 This record is limited to 300 pieces and available in two different vinyl colourways. All copies come with a digital download code and an insert. Thanks to Maddie Bajic for creating the store images and assembling the whole vinyl package. All orders come with free flyers, stickers and digital download codes whenever possible. The more you order; the more free stuff you get. All orders are usually dispatched within 24 hours. If you have been charged too much for postage, send an email to receive a partial refund. (note that postage costs include PayPal fees) Please read the FAQ section for more information.

name: DK048: Totem Skin - Still Waters Run Deep 12" LP - 180 Gram Black /100, Clear w/ Black Splatter /200
description: DK048 Totem Skin – Still Waters Run Deep 12” LP Totem Skin's shivering melodies were created in the deep forests in the outskirts of Borlänge, Sweden; conducted by 6 individuals who poured every drop of passion they could harvest from the bottom of their hearts. The band saw its dawn in the fall/winter of 2012 as a three piece, which produced and recorded two EP’s themselves while adding members as recording went along. The full line-up was completed in March 2013, allowing the band to further expand on their musical horizons. “Still Waters Run Deep” is the band’s first full length and their first real documentation since the completed formation. Recorded at the Ranch Production House in Southampton, UK and engineered by Lewis Johns (Goodtime Boys, ex-The Long Haul), the soundscape of the album ranges from raw aggression to doomy heaviness and unsettling guitar melodies. The vocals create an honest and desperate atmosphere, with the dual vocalists screaming themes of nature and problems in life. Intense grinding shares space with quiet and reverent moments, but the sonic landscape is always filled with emotion. "If you think along the lines of nature, then you think properly" - Carl Jung Stream the release in full at: Dog Knights Bandcamp PRESSING INFO Heavyweight 180 Gram Black /100 Standard weight Clear with Black Splatter /200 This release is limited to 300 copies with two different vinyl colourways. name: DK046: Pariso / Svalbard / MINE / Let It Die - Cover Buzz 7" EP - Black /40
description: DK046 Pariso / Svalbard / MINE / Let It Die - Cover Buzz 7” EP If you ever wanted a sign of how co-operative and creative UK independent labels and bands can be, then ‘Cover Buzz’ must surely be a rather decent example. Whilst all four bands usually turn in damn fine tirades of HM2blastcore (Let It Die), Turmoil-meets-Torche (Pariso), Envy meets Fucked Up (MINE) and ‘Hopesfall play stadium crust’ (Svalbard) this release signifies something very different indeed. Made to look and feel like an old jazz record for no apparent reason other than it looks fucking awesome - this is a cover versions 7 inch that celebrates punk, hardcore and powerviolence, perhaps even highlighting some classic and modern bands that fans of these bands might not have been previously aware of. Limited to a one-time pressing of 250 copies on jukebox vinyl, this release acts as a great assertion of the strength and diversity displayed between friends in bands and record labels. No bullshit, just lots of fun and even more great music. Tracks: Let It Die - War In The Head (7 Seconds) Pariso - Straight Hypocrisy Images (Witch Cult / Weekend Nachos) Svalbard - This Is The End (Victims) MINE - Everybody Hates Me (Tear It Up) Stream in full (soon) at: Dog Knights Bandcamp PRESSING INFO Black 'jukebox' vinyl /250 (40 via Dog Knights) This release is limited to 250 copies on black vinyl. All copies come with a digital download code. This is a pre-order and will ship in three-four weeks. name: DK045: Descubriendo A Mr. Mime - 12" LP w/ 3 Different Screened B-sides /83 Each
description: DK045 Descubriendo A Mr. Mime – .​.​.​y ya no me quedan dientes por arrancarme 12” LP w/ Screened B-sides After four-five months of finalising artwork and packaging ideas, we are very happy to finally present this fantastic looking vinyl package. When Rodrigo (Vocals / Artwork) first came to me with his ideas for this eight-track Mini Album/EP, the intention was to release it as a simple 10", but for some reason, I said something along the lines of 'nah, we should do a one-sided 12" and screen-print three different images on the B-sides', because, why not? After scrapping a few different ideas, we finally settled on full colour reverse-board printed 300gsm covers. Pressed on 'Ultra-Clear' vinyl so you can look at the artwork while playing the record, the B-side artwork features three 'altars' with a different animal, keepsake, skull and flowers placed on each. Depending on which version you choose, the cover will also include a sticker with matching artwork. name: DK041: Old Soul - Tidal Lock 12" LP - Mixed Marble Vinyl: Purple /30, Olive /35, Grey Mix /35
description: DK041 Old Soul – Tidal Lock 12” LP *Also available in the distro section: Old Soul - Who Are Willing To Draw Close 12" EP Old Soul was created in late 2010 by 5 friends who had a unique vision of creating a special blend of Black Metal, Post Rock and Screamo. In 2011 the band released their first recordings in form of the self released Screamo/Punk, Nature's Arms Encircle All. A mini tour of the Mid West United states ensued and was followed by the recording of 2012's Who Are Willing To Draw Close. The second album was really an extension of the first, yet saw the band's sound progress into an aggressive post punk canvas with melodic brush strokes. During the tour for this album, Old Soul Crossed paths with IFB records and plans to release it on vinyl went into effect. The vinyl was released via IFB, Dingleberry and East Rain in mid 2012. Recording for the third album "Tidal Lock" began in January 2013 and was finished in March of the same year. The bands sophomore effort is more focused on song structure and brings a blackened post rock sound with fits of aggressive metal and Screamo. This record is set for release in mid to late May 2013 via Dog Knights Productions in Europe and IFB Records in the US. An east coast tour is planned for May 2013 and will be followed by some as of yet un-announced splits. Stream the album in full at: Dog Knights Bandcamp PRESSING INFO Purple Marble /30 Olive Green Marble /35 Grey/Blue/Brown Marble Mix /35 This release is limited to 500 copies on mixed marble vinyl. There are three different colourways; Olive Green Mix, Brown Mix and Purple. 100 are available via Dog Knights in Europe and the rest are available from the band and IFB Records in the US. If you live in Norway, order from Listen To Aylin Records. All copies come with a 16 paged 9" x 6.5" booklet, screen-printed inner jackets, a full-colour foldover cover, a velum strip to wrap everything together and a download code. name: DK040: Tel Fyr / Todos Caerán - Split 12” LP - Opaque Gold /100, Green w/ Bronze Splatter /200
description: DK040 Tel Fyr / Todos Caerán - Split 12" LP I am very excited to present this brand new full length split between my two favourite bands from Canada. I first heard Tel Fyr about a year and a half ago when James/Todos Carean sent me their demo. I was blown away, and the track 'Sermon 15' was featured on the 'Dog Knights Two Year Comp' CD last May. They have spent the past year perfecting their truly unique sound, and put forward four tracks of 'Progressive Black Metal-Inspired Screamo'. This is the fourth time I've worked with Todos Caeran. After suffering multiple line-up changes in 2012, they return with their most impressive and accomplished material to date. The tagline is still undeniably 'Emotional Screamo', but on this release they have taken a more laid back approach and sound somewhere between Funeral Diner and...another band. Tracklisting: 1. Tel Fyr - Almsivi Intervention 2. Tel Fyr - Sermon 15 3. Tel Fyr - Cult of Winter 4. Tel Fyr - Aedrea 5. Todos Caerán - Flow My Tears 6. Todos Caerán - Man In the High Castle 7. Todos Caerán - Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? 8. name: DK035: Nai Harvest - Whatever 12" LP - 2nd Press - SOLD OUT - 3rd Press Coming 2014
description: DK035 Nai Harvest – Whatever 12” LP – 2nd Press Nai Harvest are a two piece emo/punk band from Sheffield, England. Ben Thompson & Lew Currie have been busy the past 18 months releasing their now sold out 7” ‘Feeling Better’, three splits and touring the UK up and down as well as mainland Europe. 'Whatever' is Nai Harvest’s first full length release, featuring 10 tracks, moving towards a bigger sound and a change in tone. Still fast and fun like their previous material but with heavier guitar tones laced with reverb, some slower grungier phrases and overall more well-structured songs. This record is a lot less ‘fiddly’ and packs a lot more of a punch. Clearly influenced by 90’s acts like Cap ‘n Jazz and The Get Up Kids, but ‘Whatever’ has it’s own unmistakable ‘Nai Harvest sound’ that the band have carefully crafted over the last 2 years. Thick guitar lines, huge twiddly riffs, catchy vocals (more mellow and melodic than the bands older sound), courageous drum fills all held together by steady solid beats. name: DK034: Epilogue Of A Car Crash…A Tribute To Orchid 12” LP - Red /250, Yellow /250
description: DK034 Epilogue of a Car Crash…A Tribute to Orchid 12” LP I had the idea for this ambitious project back in June, 2012. Once I got the go-ahead from Jayson and Will a few weeks later, I started emailing bands to take part. After having multiple bands pull out, changes to artwork, packaging and so many other delays with bands recording, I am delighted to finally launch pre-orders for the Dog Knights tribute record to the most influential Screamo band of all time. Orchid. There are 24 bands on this 44 minute record; 11 on side A and 13 on side B. Most of the tracks are from Chaos Is Me, Dance Tonight! and Gatefold, but there are also a few from the ‘skull’ split with Jerome’s Dream, the 6” split with CombatWoundedVeteran and the Self Titled 7”. I have put a lot of thought into this whole package, and I hope that Orchid fans will notice (and appreciate) the nice small touches. The cover layout for the vinyl version is a complete Dance Tonight! ‘rip’. The labels and fold-out insert inspired by the Chaos Is Me record. The CD version and Pre-order print/cover art features a re-working of Angela Davis from the Gatefold record. All artwork by Rodrigo Almanegra; who has yet again done an amazing job. name: DK033: Capacities - There Is No Neutral 10" LP - White /400
description: DK033 Capacities – There Is No Neutral 10” LP Capacities hails from New Jersey, a state known for hurricanes, "beat down" hardcore, and guidos. But what the Garden State is criminally lesser known for is the solid list of disjointed post-punk bands that paved a way for that hip internet term, "skramz". Sincere and unapologetic, Capacities is a four-piece hardcore band featuring members of Black Kites, You And I, and The Saddest Landscape. They present their own style of aggressive emotional hardcore that separates them without compromising their relevance. With songs entering and exiting close to the one-minute mark, their debut 10", "There is No Neutral", is sure to shine a different light on what New Jersey is capable of producing. 1. Personhood in the 21st Century 2. Tacenda 3. Academic Flexing 4. Through the Mill 5. Narrow Hallways / Trapped Doors 6. God to the Flatlanders 7. A Young Woman Against the Taliban 8. name: DK030: You'll Live - Above The Weather 12" LP - Seafoam Green /100, Frosted Clear /100
description: DK030 You’ll Live – Above The Weather 12” LP Above the Weather is the long awaited full length by You’ll Live. It took over a year for You’ll Live to follow their EP, Things Would Change If You Heard This, which was released in February 2011. The band has gone through several changes within the last year including losing their second guitarist and drummer. They’ve now condensed down to a three piece and still retain their strength as a live band. Above the Weather was everything that You’ll Live’s EP displayed and then some. The sound is heavy yet bright, carrying over influences from hardcore, mid-west emo to indie and low-fi. The album is a perfect balance of heavy and melodic melodies that gives You’ll Live a distinct sound. This is You’ll Live’s first vinyl release, which has been very sought out and waited for. The cover and album art compliment their sound as well, holding to their Florida beach themed roots. Above the Weather is bright, raw, sad yet energetic album that really puts a place for You’ll Live a unique and stand out band. description: DK029 We Came Out Like Tigers – Agelessness and Lack 12” LP With Agelessness and Lack, their debut full length, We Came Out Like Tigers have surpassed the “screamo” tag and pushed their sound into the realms of black metal and emo-violence, whilst retaining their intention of creating the most emotionally sincere music they are capable of. The lyrical content switches to seasonally inspired depression, cancer, antifascism, fighting the governments that enslave you, tackling organised religion, prisons and society as a prison and the importance of never losing control of the direction you want your life to take. These elements all combine to make A+L their heaviest, fastest and most brutal output, whilst at the same time combining the quietest and most heartbreakingly delicate moments for We Came Out Like Tigers thus far. name: DK028: Foxes / Iselia - Split 12" LP - Cherry Cola w/ Splatter /150, Cherry Cola /200
description: DK028 Foxes / Iselia - Split 12” LP This brand new split between Foxes and Iselia takes two bands from complete opposite sides of the world, and combines their varying styles of emotional screamo to show you exactly what both bands are truly capable of. With Iselia releasing their first full length, Life From Dead Limbs, last year, and Foxes releasing their 5-song EP in May, both bands reveal how much and how quickly they have matured and progressed. This combined effort is tied around the concept of a middle aged man lost in his own despair and depression. On the verge of suicide, he loses himself in his dreams where he is greeted by his loved ones, past and present, who take him on a journey back into his childhood years in hopes for him to reconsider the actions his melancholy has led him to. Both Iselia and Foxes pull up all the depth and emotion one would expect in embracing such a concept, bringing you into the mind of the man, and showcasing the pain and anguish he's been dealt. By merging Foxes abrasive, cold sounds with Iselia's hard-hitting and uplifting crescendos, this split release is truly a must hear. Stream the whole release in full at: Dog Knights Bandcamp This record is limited to 500 copies and available in three different vinyl colourways, one of which is black vinyl with a limited edition screen-printed pre-order cover. Foxes will have some black vinyl (without the screened cover) and Iselia will have some cherry cola vinyl to sell at shows in a couple of months. If you want the limited versions or shirts, you must order from Dog Knights. Loads of package deals are also available that include The Life in Dead Limbs 12” LP by Iselia and the self titled 12” EP by Foxes. Cavalcades, from Aberdeen, Scotland, formed at the end of 2010, but have already achieved a lot. After a string of sold out splits and self-released EPs, they toured the UK for the first time in February 2012, and went on a huge 19 date summer tour throughout the whole of Europe with Canada’s Todos Caeran. description: DK005: Maths - Descent 12" LP - Second Press In 2010, Dog Knights Productions released the critically acclaimed 'Descent' by Maths onto vinyl for the first time. This 12" LP was limited to 250 copies and sold out pretty quickly. For those who missed out; it is being given a very limited re-press on black vinyl with screen-printed covers. Descent is a screamo classic; beautiful, depressing, chaotic and emotional. This is one of my favourite albums of all time and it gives me no greater pleasure than to share it with you one last time. Do not miss out this time. RIP Maths. 13 tracks including the bonus 'Change (in the House of Flies)', originally by Deftones.
